data.title: Great pizza
data.text: We have been a number of times and we can always count on great hot food and cold beer. Have never had a bad meal.

data.title: RUDE SERVERS, WRONG ORDERS, AND OVERCHARGED
data.text:
WELL, I keep seeing all these facebook post that this place outs out and I thought I would take the kids out and enjoy our evening but I was SO very wrong. 

First, there is not a lot of easy parking, You are parking on the side of a busy street, so be prepared to be ran over before you walk into the business. 

Once we got in, we were seated and our server came. He seemed nice at first. He took our order (there were 6 people) but never rode anything down. SO the order was entirely wrong. 

1 huge slice of pizza is $8 and only includes cheese. Each veggie added is 50 cents and each meat is $1. 

5 of us ordered the huge slices and with everyone wanting different items, it would be a lot for the server to remember, However, since he didn't write down our order, the order was wrong.

 My son order 2 veggies plus pepperoni and it came out as 2 veggies plus sausage. When my son told him that his was wrong, the server said "sorry, it takes too long to make you another pizza". I responded by saying "excuse me, that is not the pizza that he ordered and he doesn't like sausage." The server responded by saying that he would just throw some pepperoni on there and my son could eat it like that without charging me for the extra meat. I told the server that he doesn't like sausage, it wasn't what he ordered and he should take it back, plus I wasn't paying any extra for something that we didn't order. In the end, the sever had a new pizza made. He told us it would be ready in 20 minutes and it took 5  minutes. 

Then my husband ordered the pizza burger with onion rings. He got fries instead. 

The appetizers ordered were pizza fries at $10. They are incredibly salty and so greasy and soggy. Don't waste your money on them. The onion rings say that they are handed breaded but they look and taste like prepackaged frozen rings and the ranch tastes like tartar sauce. 

The sodas are $2.50/each. The server constantly refilled the kids sodas but would never refill my soda or my husbands water. 
 
The pizza is super thin on crust an not crispy. Everything slides off of the pizza when attempting to eat it. It was ok tasting but not worth the money. 

The last straw was when the server added a 20% tip to the bill automatically without seeing anywhere on the menu that is automatically done for certain party sizes. And then he charged someone elses $118.21 bill on my credit card PLUS my $111.24 bill with his tip. Then came to tell me sorry for the inconvience It should fall off in 3 days. 

I am so ticked off at this dinner. The server has a poor attitude and defiantly was not deserving of that tip. I am still sitting here 6 days later waiting for the credit of someone elses bill to go through. 

Save yourself the hassle! DO NOT GO HERE!!!!!!

data.title: Awesome Brooklyn Style Pizza.
data.text: On our way to the baseball game last night we decided to go get something to eat so we stopped here. I am glad we did. The last time I had pizza like this was in New York. I ordered the giant slice and it was the size of a small pizza. They were not joking about it being giant. It was perfect, not greasy, and delicious. Just the right amount of gooey cheese and very tasty pepperoni. My friend ordered a buffalo chicken grinder with fries. This sandwich came out in a basket and, like the pizza, it was huge. Big chunks of buffalo chicken smothered in Mozzarella cheese. It also had a very large portion of fries. The food here is great. Our server, Jessica was awesome. Very polite, happy, and friendly. She knew the specials for the day and told us about them and also talked to us about the comedy club which is located in the upstairs floor of Mesquite Street (I'll write a review for that soon). All of the staff here seemed friendly and greeted everyone who came through the door. You won't be disappointed if you go here. I will be back.

data.title: Pizza
data.text: Great food. Interesting atmosphere. Fun place. Easy to get to.  We missed the comedy show. Legalize marinara! Stop by here during your next trip to the coast!

data.title: BEST for $5 lunch slices!
data.text:
We eat here often when in the CC downtown area. Best huge pepperoni slices at lunch Mon-Fri. Can be a bit pricey for individual pizzas, and IMHO, not quite as tasty. FRESH ingredients always, and a super thin flavorful crust, but not too crispy, or dough-y. Perfect crust. The salads are good. We've wanted to try the Hoagies (they look delish!)...maybe next time. Comedy routines offered often at night.

The only better pizza I've had was in Chicago, so this place is a great addition to Corpus!

data.title: Great service and great place!
data.text: We all enjoyed our lunch. I had pepperoni pizza which was think and crispy, a salad and a drink & knots for $14.56. A lot of food for the $! I will be back with my family.

data.title: Amazing Bacon Avocado Cheeseburger!
data.text:
The Bacon Avocado Cheeseburger is a rectangular beef patty topped with crispy bacon crumbles, avocado, provolone cheese, lettuce, tomato, pickles, and red onion... and it is INCREDIBLE!  We went to Mesquite Street Pizza & Pasta Company, fully intending to try the pizza.  I mean, you go to a pizza place for that, right?  But we're always open to suggestions, so we let the waitress know it was our first time there and asked for her recommendation. She told us about this burger.

It's funny - we've tried quite a few burgers and wonder why some places struggle to keep them juicy.  This was not a question that ever formed here... it was juicy and delicious!  The ingredients were fresh and perfect - not a mealy spot on the tomatoes, nor a brown blemish on the avocado.  Even the red onions were perfectly crisp, sweet, and didn't scald your senses.  Such a great combination of flavors and all on a soft, sweet bun.  Killer sandwich!  

For sides, we tried the onion rings and the fries.  Both were good, but the fries were seasoned in a way that made you want to devote yourself to a plate of them.  

Crumbling the bacon on the burger seemed like an interesting choice until you realize the reason... it's easy to bite in to!  You're not having to tear through bacon.  The cheese melted over the bacon held it onto the beef patty and they definitely did NOT skimp out on the bacon.  

​You really just can't go wrong with this burger - it was perfect!  We'll definitely be back to try more of the menu, but if you're like us and it's your first time heading over there, yeah... give that burger a go!

For more amazing dishes to try, check us out on drooldish!

data.title: Great thin pizza
data.text: There was about a 30 minute wait when we arrived. A server came out and told the hostess she had a couple available tables. But they weren't offered to us or the other couple waiting. I finally looked at her and said we would like a table and she mentioned others had their name on the list but weren't around. We did get a table after she realized she wasn't sure they would be back. Had the buffalo chicken pizza and fried pickles.

data.title: Best Food in Corpus Downtown
data.text: This place is a gem.  You can eat in or take out.  The Pizza (Thin Crust) comes out just magical out of the oven. This is always a stop for us when we do Corpus.

data.title: First visit
data.text: Always been wanting to this joint out never made it. Glad I finally did today, it's a very nice quiant botuiqe style pizzeria in the heart of Downtown. Staff is friendly, place in inviting and overall excellent experience will comeback for sure. I had the pizza burger A+++, next time trying the pizza that marinara sauce was to die for. Go and try this pizzeria/american restraunt out you will not be dissapointed.

data.title: Meh....and hire some waitstaff
data.text:
The small restaurant was packed on a Saturday night with a server running interference between the door (the hostess was MIA) and her tables. There were eight in my party so I was surprised that we were seated fairly quickly.

We ordered fried mushrooms and mozzarella sticks for an appetizer. Both were nothing special. We ordered four different pizzas of varying sizes and a build your own pasta. The best thing about the pizza was the crust. We all agreed that the pizza seriously lacked flavor, seasoning, something! My daughter's build your own pasta of fettuccine, tomato cream sauce, mushrooms, spinach and grilled chicken was tasty but marred by the finding of a large metal shaving apparently from a can. A couple of us shared a piece of plain cheesecake that could have been bought at the grocery store. 

For a Saturday night, the lack of waitstaff was pretty astonishing. I think our poor waitress had 98% of the tables. She did the absolute best that she could considering that she had so many tables. 

We won't be going back unless they buy some seasoning for their pizzas and hire more waitstaff.

data.title: pizza is always great
data.text: Pizza was great!  Too many crazy rules to be able to order their specials.  Staff seemed to be overwhelmed with large groups.

data.title: Pricey Pizza
data.text:
Tried this place for dinner and i was surprised at how expensive the pizza was.  The menu had lunch specials which looked much more reasonable, but pizza any other time of the day (and weekends) is overpriced.  A large NY slice is $15 for dinner.  A 12" plain pizza for 2 is $13 and then charges for toppings.  It really surprised me that a NY slice costs more than a 12" pie.  We created our own with 2 toppings and it was good.  Pizza was very fresh and the crust and thin and crispy.  I also got a salad with no complaints.  
The staff was all very friendly and we didnt have to wait long at all for our food.  
I enjoyed what i ate, i just think it was overpriced.  But unfortunately, in Corpus there aren't many pizza places so i guess they can charge what they want.

data.title: I have eaten there 3 times and had 2/3 times great food
data.text: I liked their food but their service the last two times was rather slow like they didn`t have enough people working there.

data.title: Excellent Marinara!
data.text: We visited on a Sunday afternoon. My friend and I shared the Alfredo Bacon Fries which were great! We also shared the garlic knots with the house made marinara. We both love the marinara! The price is average and the staff was friendly. The comedy club is located inside as well.

data.title: Nothing special, like really
data.text: Went for a comedy show, which was great. Everyone who performed was hilarious. Had been wanting to try the pizza because I had heard so many great things about it. My boyfriend and I shared the meatball pizza and both tried a big red margarita. The pizza was basic, tasted like something out of a box, with thin crust. The meatballs were just ground beef, absolutely no flavor. The Big Red Margaritas (admittedly by the bartender) were weak and are never strong. These are $10 drinks mind you. so $20 on two margaritas that were weak, $20 on pizza that was sub-par. Nothing was bad or went wrong, it just wasn't quality food. If I return it will be for the comedy, I'll eat first and have drinks after. Oh, also the server we ordered from definitely seemed in the weeds. she wasn't rude to us but she was very rude to the guy who ordered before us, who coincidentally was sitting right next to us

data.title: For Pizza Lovers
data.text: We wanted to try a new place in town so we dropped by for some pizza. The place does have a comedy club inside.  The pizza is thin crust which was delicious. The brand of sweet tea they use is not as good as some others out there. The bartender was very nice and helpful with some questions we had about the drinks. The service was a little slow. We paid with a credit card and later that day we received an email receipt which we did not request and was concerned how they got our email address. We were not comfortable about the information that was pulled off the card.
